intro: Sarcocephalus pobeguinii, commonly known as the African wild tea, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The species is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
